title: Firehose grasping is non physical on body movement

content.raw:
Grasping the firehose coupling is unstable on body movement. Any body movement against the axis of the grasp makes it non-physical. 

- See [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iBD9FAfLguI](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iBD9FAfLguI).

**Setup**

1. grasp commands via sandia_hand_msgs/SimpleGrasp.
1. and keyboard teleop to move a pinned robot.



- Tested torque based power grasps upto max torque limits in the hand urdf  (28Nm- which is very high), the problem persists.
- The problem persists for position based grasps also.
- Tested on a simple geometry such as a cylinder to replace the hexagonal mesh and the problem persists ([http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GhE6_uxgLpA](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GhE6_uxgLpA)).
- Experimented with the min_depth and mu,mu2 parameters for both the hands and the firehose sdf and the problem persists.

We think this is a simulation issue that needs to be resolved to enable body movement while holding objects.

Grasping the firehose coupling is unstable on body movement. Any body movement against the axis of the grasp makes it non-physical.

  • See http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iBD9FAfLguI.

Setup

  1. grasp commands via sandia_hand_msgs/SimpleGrasp.
  2. and keyboard teleop to move a pinned robot.
  • Tested torque based power grasps upto max torque limits in the hand urdf (28Nm- which is very high), the problem persists.
  • The problem persists for position based grasps also.
  • Tested on a simple geometry such as a cylinder to replace the hexagonal mesh and the problem persists (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GhE6_uxgLpA).
  • Experimented with the min_depth and mu,mu2 parameters for both the hands and the firehose sdf and the problem persists.

We think this is a simulation issue that needs to be resolved to enable body movement while holding objects.
